comments: Moderate value habitat. Only a few areas with fines suitable for spawning. Mostly cobbles in stream. Wide channel throughout with a lot of woody debris. Large amounts of undercut banks that can provide cover. But not many deep pools. Some steep eroding banks found every  so often. 15:47:55

Mostly wetland habitat, with 3 big beaver dams spaced evenly along surveyed length. Multiple channels after first beaver dam, separated by heavily vegetated banks. Muddy bed material with some fines and gravels but nothing bigger. More gravels closer to downstream culvert that are suitable for spawning. Deep pools near wetland that can be suitable for rearing if habitat is opened up. 10:13:24
Open wetland habitat with shrubs and floodplain. Beaver dam approx 100m downstream of culvert. 11:40:52

Moderate value habitat. Numerous cascades that are approx 1m in height, with deep pools below. Wide stream throughout with abundant large woody debris. Dam upstream. Average gradient of 7. Trace areas with gravels that could be suitable for spawning. 12:58:40
Steep stretch but good moderate value habitat. Mostly cobbles with some gravels. Parking block approx. 0.7m in height that was used to attempt to backwater the outler. 14:38:38

Moderate value habitat. Abundant cover from woody debris, overhanging vegetation and undercut banks. Wide channel throughout with graveled areas suitable for spawning. Trace distribution of deep pools suitable for rearing. A couple smaller cascades (<1m in height) that may block smaller fish. 11:23:33
Bedrock pools at top end of site. Cascade and riffle pools with lots of cover. 13:58:20
Mostly riffles, steep section. Some deep pools at top end of site where the channel is much wider. Mostly cobbles with some gravels and boulders. 14:39:58
No comments provided. 13:29:27

Medium value habitat for ST, DV, CCT and CO. Approximately 500m upstream of crossing. This is a high energy system with numerous areas of multiple channel and islands and elevated bars. High flows are pushing most large woody debris out of the main channel resulting in lower complexity and most cover was available as boulders. There are rare pockets of gravel suitable for spawning. 13:44:56

High value habitat. Abundant gravels suitable for CO, ST, and RB spawning. Local knowledge of historic CO spawning in system. Multiple large beaver dams in site. Stream flows adjacent to community of Glen Vowell and supplies community drinking water. Upstream end of site was upstream of beaver dam complex on southern tributary. 10:10

Medium value habitat. This is upstream tributary to main stream that enters beaver dam complex. Steeper, smaller stream with extensive areas of gravel suitable for resident and anadronous salmonids. Multiple small steps from large and small woody debris at 20-40cm high. Healthy old growth riparian forest. 11:51

High value habitat. This is major contributing tributary to downstream flow. Abundant gravels suitable for spawning, sporadic pools suitable for juvenile CO/ST overwintering. Mature old growth mixed riparian providing stable channel and large woody debris. Wildlife trails throughout forest. 12:30

SFC sample site. High value habitat, abundant gravels suitable for resident and anadronous spawning. Debris in downstream section potentially an access issue. Frequent pools due to LWD in canyon that was not logged. 14:48
High value habitat. Boulder cover throughout, gravels throughout. Few pools. Known ST stream with local landowner reporting spawning in tributaries of highway. 17:48
Glide habitat with some steep sections and boulder cover. One small patch of gravel. 12:06:20

Medium value fish habitat. Water runs cool and clear, with good flow. Riparian is healthy, plenty of shade and cover present. Bed material consists of cobbles and boulders, also there are small pockets of gravel suitable for spawning. Some features may be natural barriers to fish passage, although during high flow there's a good chance strong fish can make it up. Plenty of pools available for fish to inhabit, large woody debris and small woody debris as well as boulders are quite functional and force complexity into the stream. Stream is located mostly in a bed rock canyon, shrubs hang over the stream, taking up about 2 m on either side of the bank. 11:27:01
One rainbow captured along with numerous cutthroat. Low-gradient shallow glide with some riffle. Small woody debris, boulders and undercut banks throughout most of survey. 11:39:32

Slightly deeper pool glide habitat for approximately 10 m at the bottom then some shallower riffle and glide in the top end. Lots of small woody debris in the deepest areas of the pool where majority of the larger fish were captured. 15:22:36
Mostly riffle habitat with some shallow glide and small woody debris. 14:29:31

Because the stream was primarily dewatered downstream of the outlet pool this site consisted of the outlet pool only. Only a portion of the fish present in the outlet pool were sampled due to time constraints. 12:48:19

Shallow pools with very large boulder on right bank, flat faced area, isolated pocket because the majority of the channel is dewatered. Two passes of the same site were done but fish were not separated into passes. Some uncertainty about whether fish marked as cutthroat or actually rainbow. There are yellow slashes under the chin but the mouth does not reach past the eye and we haven't seen any larger age class fish with the slash. The big fish all appear to be rainbow, suspect the small ones may also be rainbow. Unless they're hybrids. During the fish processing process it appeared that it is very likely that all of the fish that were classified as cutthroat were actually rainbow. We didn't find any larger fish with red slashes and as the fish got larger it appeared the yellow slight yellow slashes underneath the chins got lighter and lighter. 13:04:29

Has potential for fish but gradient is steep. Bank full depth is very high and when stream is high it fans out. The abundance of large woody debris is the main factor in stream direction and development. Some large woody debris jams present that are approximately 1m in height. Other streams near creek have higher water level, may be one stream. 12:50:07
Abundance of large woody debris jams help with pools and water diversion as well as create natural steps. 10:12:00
Abundant overhanging vegetation and a lot of downed trees, stream mainly consists of gravels and cobbles, infrequent shallow pools. 15:22:44

Initially steep below falls, cascading with pools. Bedrock dominated substrate. Further downstream gratient is ~4%. Lots of undercut banks with some pools. Healthy riparian vegetation providing cover. Functional debris habitat. Overall very nice stream, good flows, plentiful habitat. Large woody debris jam was big but had water running under.

Stream had signs of high flow based on eroded steep sided banks. However still a nice mix of habitat available including periodic undercut banks and lots of overhanging vegetation. Gradient relatively stable at 4 degrees although there were some woody debris jams which could impede travel on some flows. One fish sighted in outlet pool.
